result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $125(per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lorraine G.
- Defendant shall not be at 2424 E Washington Ave.
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 10/25/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

10:02 AM Defendant Charles D Young in court.  Prosecuting attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the PTS violation report. Argument by the ADA for a cash bond and amendment to conditions. Re: prelim hearing - court explained the process to the defn. Court found good cause to waive time limits and set for a STC. Further argument re: bail violations. PTS appeared by C.H. who made stmts to the court. Court ordered cash bail of $125.00. Geographical restriction amended to not be at 2424 E. Washington Ave. All other conditions to remain the same, including referral to PTS if cash bail is posted. Defn taken into custody.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: Address this additional Report at 10/25/2022 Bail/Bond Hearing

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lorraine G.

1:44 PM Defendant Charles D Young in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Charles D Young.  Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
